duck: In German, Haupt in the broadest sense means something on the top of a hierarchy.

milestones: US military confirms authenticity of Standard Operating Procedures for Guantanamo Bay
Standard Operating Procedure changes at Camp Delta, Guantanamo Bay

wiki.text:
In German, '{{lang|de|Haupt}}' in the broadest sense means something on the top
of a hierarchy.

Regarding the human body, the usage of {{lang|de|Haupt}} for the head is
considered antiquated or poetic, Kopf is being used instead. But Haupt still
appears in figures of speech, as in compounds ({{lang|de|[[Hauptbahnhof]]}},
{{lang|de|[[Hauptmann]]}}, {{lang|de|[[Hauptschule]]}},
{{lang|de|[[Hauptwohnsitz]]}}) where its meaning equals the usage of the English
main (e.g. Hauptreaktor = main reactor)

Also, {{lang|de|Haupt}} describes the most important person or element
of a group:

* {{lang|de|das Haupt der Familie}} ("head of family"),
* {{lang|de|das Haupt der Hanse}} (the city of Lübeck, having led the
  Hanseatic League).

Derived from {{lang|de|Haupt}} are Häuptling ("chieftain") and Enthauptung
("beheading").
wiki.title: haupt
